column2: ENGLISH
Put under House Arrest
As your prisoner, §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! can be put under house arrest.
Throw into Oubliette
As your prisoner, §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! can be thrown into the Oubliette.
Move to Dungeon
As your prisoner, §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! can be moved into a regular dungeon cell.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to let me out of this filthy dungeon and put me under house arrest. I am even now being moved to a nice room in a tower.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided I am to be let out of this hellish, stinking cell and instead put under house arrest. I think I shall need a bath first.
Praise [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]!
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided I should be taken from my comfortable room in the tower and down into the Oubliette! This will truly be the end of me.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided I am be taken from my cell and down into the Oubliette! What could I have done to deserve this fate?
[Root.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap] have mercy...
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided I should be taken from my comfortable room in the tower and returned to a dungeon cell! Surely this is unnecessary?
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided I shall be allowed out of the cursed oubliette and put into a regular cell. It's not much of an improvement.
[Root.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap] preserve me!
Thank [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] for small mercies.
§Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! will be treated better, but security will also be more relaxed.\n\n
§Y[Root.GetTitledName]'s§! health will greatly suffer, and [Root.GetSubjectPronoun] will be very unlikely to escape.\n\n
§Y[Root.GetTitledName]'s§! health will suffer, and [Root.GetSubjectPronoun] will be less likely to escape.\n\n
§Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! will be treated slightly better and still be unlikely to escape.\n\n
